intro: Symplocos boonjee, commonly known as the Indian snowberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Symplocos boonjee thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Its foliage and fruit make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
